title: Google\Cloud\BigQuery\DataTransfer\V1\TransferConfig
name: TransferConfig
description:
Represents a data transfer configuration. A transfer configuration contains all metadata needed to perform a data transfer. For example, destination_dataset_id specifies where data should be stored.

When a new transfer configuration is created, the specified destination_dataset_id is created when needed and shared with the appropriate data source service account.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.bigquery.datatransfer.v1.TransferConfig

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: The resource name of the transfer config. Transfer config names have the form projects/{project_id}/locations/{region}/transferConfigs/{config_id}. Where config_id is usually a uuid, even though it is not guaranteed or required. The name is ignored when creating a transfer config.

params.name: data.destination_dataset_id
params.description: The BigQuery target dataset id.

params.name: data.display_name
params.description: User specified display name for the data transfer.

params.name: data.data_source_id
params.description: Data source id. Cannot be changed once data transfer is created.

params.name: data.params
params.description: Parameters specific to each data source. For more information see the bq tab in the 'Setting up a data transfer' section for each data source. For example the parameters for Cloud Storage transfers are listed here: https://cloud.google.com/bigquery-transfer/docs/cloud-storage-transfer#bq

params.name: data.schedule
params.description: Data transfer schedule. If the data source does not support a custom schedule, this should be empty. If it is empty, the default value for the data source will be used. The specified times are in UTC. Examples of valid format: 1st,3rd monday of month 15:30, every wed,fri of jan,jun 13:15, and first sunday of quarter 00:00. See more explanation about the format here: https://cloud.google.com/appengine/docs/flexible/python/scheduling-jobs-with-cron-yaml#the_schedule_format NOTE: The minimum interval time between recurring transfers depends on the data source; refer to the documentation for your data source.

params.name: data.schedule_options
params.description: Options customizing the data transfer schedule.

params.name: data.data_refresh_window_days
params.description: The number of days to look back to automatically refresh the data. For example, if data_refresh_window_days = 10, then every day BigQuery reingests data for [today-10, today-1], rather than ingesting data for just [today-1]. Only valid if the data source supports the feature. Set the value to 0 to use the default value.

params.name: data.disabled
params.description: Is this config disabled. When set to true, no runs are scheduled for a given transfer.

params.name: data.update_time
params.description: Output only. Data transfer modification time. Ignored by server on input.

params.name: data.next_run_time
params.description: Output only. Next time when data transfer will run.

params.name: data.state
params.description: Output only. State of the most recently updated transfer run.

params.name: data.user_id
params.description: Deprecated. Unique ID of the user on whose behalf transfer is done.

params.name: data.dataset_region
params.description: Output only. Region in which BigQuery dataset is located.

params.name: data.notification_pubsub_topic
params.description: Pub/Sub topic where notifications will be sent after transfer runs associated with this transfer config finish. The format for specifying a pubsub topic is: projects/{project}/topics/{topic}

params.name: data.email_preferences
params.description: Email notifications will be sent according to these preferences to the email address of the user who owns this transfer config.

params.name: data.owner_info
params.description: Output only. Information about the user whose credentials are used to transfer data. Populated only for transferConfigs.get requests. In case the user information is not available, this field will not be populated.

methods.name: getDataRefreshWindowDays
methods.description:
The number of days to look back to automatically refresh the data.

For example, if data_refresh_window_days = 10, then every day BigQuery reingests data for [today-10, today-1], rather than ingesting data for just [today-1]. Only valid if the data source supports the feature. Set the value to 0 to use the default value.
